title: What are the six paths to liberation and the concept of co-nascence in yogic philosophy?
first_phrase: This section discusses the six paths to liberation, which include having faith in wise teachers, making pure vows, going on wilderness retreats, practicing protective rituals, and living in solitude. The author then discusses the concept of "co-nascenza" or co-being, which involves a sense of shared knowledge and existence. The text also explores the six "immensities" that provide a sense of security, including contemplation and the continuity of the soul. The section concludes with mentions of inner heat and the physical sensations experienced by the Yogi during meditation. The technical references to yoga philosophy are explained in the notes.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the practice of yoga offers a path towards feeling good and finding satisfaction in the state of not knowing fault. Through the meeting and fusion of ida and pingala, the fundamental polarities of masculine and feminine forces, one can attain an inner heat and experience the six immensities that provide certainty in the continuity and vastness of the soul.
